nodes.notes: This comprehensive example demonstrates ALL canvas features: multiple node types, zones with semantic types, edge customization, attachments, personas, and complex workflows. Use this as a playground to test every feature!
iOS/Android app for symptom logging, appointments, and messaging
nodes.designerDescription: Primary patient touchpoint for daily health management

nodes.notes: Desktop interface for medical records and communication
nodes.designerDescription: Full-featured portal for comprehensive health management

nodes.notes: Voice-based triage and emergency support
nodes.designerDescription: Always-available voice support for urgent needs

nodes.notes: Apple Watch, Fitbit, continuous monitoring devices
nodes.designerDescription: Passive health data collection from patient devices

nodes.notes: Primary user seeking healthcare services
Licensed doctor providing clinical care
Triage, care coordination, patient education
Scheduling, billing, insurance verification
Patient describes symptoms, pain level, duration, and medical history context

attachments.notes: Free-form symptom description
Structured intake form (pain scale, duration, etc.)

nodes.notes: Automatically pull heart rate, blood pressure, sleep data, activity levels from connected devices

attachments.notes: Continuous vital sign data (HR, BP, SpO2)

nodes.notes: Classify urgency: Emergency (call 911), Urgent (same-day), Routine (schedule appointment)

attachments.notes: Patient symptom description
Recent vital signs
Urgency level + confidence score
If confidence < 0.80, escalate to human nurse immediately
Always err on side of caution for chest pain, breathing issues, severe injuries

nodes.notes: Human nurse validates AI triage for high-urgency cases, may call patient directly

attachments.notes: All emergency classifications require human confirmation within 5 minutes

nodes.notes: Suggests 3 appointment slots based on: patient availability, provider schedule, appointment type, travel time

attachments.notes: Calendar availability, provider specialties
Recommended appointment slots with reasoning
Urgent appointments: within 24 hours; Routine: within 2 weeks
Confirmation details (time, location, provider)
Appointment records retained for 7 years per HIPAA

nodes.designerDescription: Create appointment in Electronic Health Record, send confirmations, block calendar

nodes.notes: Deliver confirmation via: SMS, email, push notification, calendar invite

attachments.notes: Include: date/time, provider name, location with map, prep instructions
Messages must be accessible (screen reader compatible, plain language)

nodes.notes: Physical visit with healthcare provider
Doctor examines patient, reviews history, orders tests, provides diagnosis

attachments.notes: Patient history, triage notes, vital signs
Clinical notes, diagnosis codes (ICD-10), treatment plan

nodes.notes: Transcribe doctor-patient conversation, extract structured clinical data, generate visit summary

attachments.notes: Consultation audio recording
Structured clinical note (SOAP format)
HIPAA-compliant: audio deleted after transcription, encrypted in transit

nodes.notes: Suggest differential diagnoses, flag drug interactions, recommend evidence-based treatments

attachments.notes: Symptoms, patient history, test results
Suggested diagnoses with evidence citations
Present as suggestions only; final diagnosis always physician's responsibility

nodes.notes: Doctor writes prescription based on diagnosis, considers allergies and interactions

attachments.notes: Electronic prescription (drug, dose, frequency, duration)

nodes.notes: Transmit prescription via secure network (NCPDP SCRIPT standard)

attachments.notes: Encrypted transmission, audit log required

nodes.notes: Patient picks up medication at local pharmacy
Create patient-friendly care instructions: medication schedule, lifestyle changes, follow-up actions

attachments.notes: Diagnosis, prescriptions, doctor's recommendations
Plain-language care plan (PDF/markdown)
Use plain language (8th grade reading level), avoid medical jargon
Available in multiple languages, visual format for low-literacy patients

nodes.notes: Write back: clinical notes, diagnosis codes, prescriptions, care plan to central EHR

attachments.notes: Medical records retained permanently per federal law
HIPAA-compliant storage with encryption at rest and in transit

nodes.notes: Schedule and send: medication reminders, appointment booking prompts, symptom check-ins

attachments.notes: Personalized reminder messages

nodes.notes: Aggregate anonymized data: patient outcomes, treatment efficacy, resource utilization

attachments.notes: Dashboards: wait times, readmission rates, patient satisfaction
De-identified data only for analytics (HIPAA safe harbor method)

nodes.notes: Admin staff verifies coverage, submits claims, processes payments, handles denials

attachments.notes: Diagnosis codes, procedure codes, patient insurance info

nodes.notes: Query insurance databases in real-time: verify coverage, check deductibles, estimate patient cost

attachments.notes: Coverage details, estimated out-of-pocket cost

nodes.notes: Comprehensive EHR: demographics, allergies, medications, conditions, visit history
Clinical guidelines, drug databases, research papers, treatment protocols
Federal privacy law: patient data security, access controls, breach notification
Emergency: <5 min; Urgent: <2 hours; Routine: <24 hours
Evidence-based medicine, HEDIS quality measures, patient safety protocols
Cost per patient visit, insurance reimbursement rates, resource allocation
Multi-channel patient input: symptoms, vitals, preferences
Intelligent urgency assessment and appointment coordination
Physician consultation with AI-powered documentation and diagnosis assistance
Prescription delivery, care plan creation, automated patient engagement
Patient records and medical knowledge base
Privacy, quality, time, and cost requirements
Insurance verification and billing processes

AI handles: triage classification, appointment scheduling, medical transcription, diagnosis suggestions, care plan generation, follow-up automation, and eligibility verification. All clinical decisions remain with licensed professionals.
Look for edges with custom paths, labels, and attachments throughout the diagram. Some edges have customX/Y for curved paths, and several carry data/constraint attachments showing information flow.
Notice the colored zones with semantic types: Cyan=Touchpoint zones, Purple/Blue=Task zones, Amber=Data zone, Rose=Constraint zone. Click zone sections in the inspector to highlight contained nodes!

An AI-powered healthcare coordination platform demonstrating patient intake â†’ triage â†’ scheduling â†’ clinical care â†’ prescription fulfillment â†’ follow-up.

  ---
  âœ… FEATURES DEMONSTRATED

  1. ALL NODE TYPES

  | Type                            | Count   |    Examples
  |-----------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  | AI Tasks                      | 10         | Symptom triage, appointment scheduling, medical scribe, diagnosis support, care plan generation, follow-up automation, eligibility verification
  | Human Tasks              | 5          | Symptom logging, nurse review, physician consultation, prescription writing, insurance processing
  | System Tasks             | 6          | Vital collection, calendar booking, notifications, EHR updates, analytics generation, pharmacy transmission
  | Data Nodes                 | 2          | Patient medical record, Medical knowledge base
  | Constraint Nodes       | 4          | HIPAA compliance, Response time SLAs, Clinical quality standards, Budget constraints
  | Touchpoint Nodes      | 6         | Mobile app, web portal, phone hotline, wearables, clinic, pharmacy
  | Actor Nodes                | 4         | Patient, Physician, Nurse, Admin staff

  Total Nodes: 37 task/data/constraint/touchpoint/actor nodes

  ---
  2. ZONES WITH SEMANTIC TYPES

  | Zone                                      | Semantic Type.    | Purpose                                                      | Color  |
  |-----------------------------|-------------------|------------------------------------------|--------|
  | Patient Intake.                       | touchpoint            | Multi-channel data collection                   | Cyan   |
  | AI-Assisted Triage                | task                       | Intelligent urgency assessment                | Purple |
  | Clinical Care                          | task                       | Physician consultation + AI support.       | Blue   |
  | Treatment Fulfillment            | task                       | Prescription & care plan delivery             | Green  |
  | Core Data Assets                  | data.                      | Patient records + knowledge base          | Amber  |
  | Governance & Constraints   | constraint              | Privacy, quality, time, cost rules              | Rose   |
  | Administrative Ops               | none.                     | Billing and insurance                                 | Gray   |

  Total Zones: 7 zones (5 with semantic types)

  Zone Features Demonstrated:
  - âœ… Zones contain multiple nodes
  - âœ… Semantic types make zones connectable
  - âœ… Color coding by function
  - âœ… Nested node containment
  - âœ… Zone inspector will show grouped contents

  ---
  3. ANNOTATIONS

  Sticky Notes: 4 documentation notes
  - System introduction
  - AI role explanation
  - Edge customization guide
  - Zone semantic types guide

  Use: Double-click to edit, provides context for the system

  ---
  4. EDGE FEATURES

  Total Edges: 35 connections

  Edge Demonstrations:
  - âœ… Simple edges: Direct node-to-node connections (most edges)
  - âœ… Labeled edges: 5 edges with descriptive labels
    - "Voice to text"
    - "If urgent/emergency"
    - "If routine"
    - "Conversation audio"
    - "Suggestions"
  - âœ… Custom path edges: 15+ edges with customX, customY, sourceX, targetX for curved/adjusted paths
  - âœ… Edge attachments: 2 edges with data attachments
    - Urgency classification data
    - Differential diagnoses data

  ---
  5. NODE ATTACHMENTS

  Rich Attachment Demonstrations:

  Data Attachments (input/output specifications):
  - Patient symptom descriptions
  - Vital sign data
  - Audio recordings
  - Transcripts
  - Embeddings
  - Care plans
  - Prescriptions
  - Clinical notes

  Constraint Attachments (rules and limitations):
  - Confidence thresholds
  - Privacy requirements (HIPAA)
  - Human-in-the-loop requirements
  - Response time SLAs
  - Data retention policies
  - Quality standards
  - Accessibility requirements
  - Plain language guidelines

  Example Node with Multiple Attachments: AI Triage task has 5 attachments (2 input data, 1 output data, 2 constraints)

  ---
  6. AI CAPABILITIES

  Demonstrated AI Capabilities:
  - âœ… Zero-Shot Classification (symptom triage)
  - âœ… Text Generation (scheduling, care plans, follow-ups)
  - âœ… Automatic Speech Recognition (medical scribe)
  - âœ… Question Answering (diagnosis support, eligibility checks)
  - âœ… Summarization (care plan generation)

  ---
  7. PERSONAS

  4 Personas Across Categories:

  | Persona             | Role                   | Color  | Category | Initials |
  |---------------------|------------------------|--------|----------|----------|
  | Patient             | Healthcare Consumer    | Blue   | human    | PT       |
  | Clinician           | Physician/NP           | Green  | human    | MD       |
  | Admin               | Administrative Staff   | Gray   | human    | AD       |
  | AI Care Coordinator | Intelligent automation | Purple | ai       | AI       |

  Features:
  - âœ… Multiple persona assignments to tasks
  - âœ… Human, AI, and System categories
  - âœ… Color-coded for visual distinction
  - âœ… Role descriptions

  ---
  8. ADVANCED FEATURES

  Designer Descriptions (Experiential View):
  - Touchpoint nodes have designerDescription fields
  - Example: "Primary patient touchpoint for daily health management"
  - Used in experiential view mode for UX-focused perspective

  Node Measurements:
  - All nodes have measuredW and measuredH fields
  - Ensures consistent rendering

  Custom Labels:
  - Nearly every node has descriptive customLabel
  - Provides context beyond reference IDs

  Notes:
  - Every node includes detailed notes explaining purpose
  - Rich documentation for learning

  ---
  ðŸŽ¯ HOW TO USE THIS EXAMPLE

  Loading the Example:

  1. Open the Builder canvas
  2. Click "Import" or file upload
  3. Select /data/examples/healthcare-coordination.json
  4. The entire system will load with all nodes, edges, zones, and personas

  Testing Features:

  1. Zone Inspector:
    - Select any zone â†’ Inspector shows contained nodes grouped by type
    - Click section headers to highlight node types
    - Click individual attachments to highlight nodes containing them
  2. Multi-Select:
    - Shift+click multiple nodes
    - Bulk actions bar appears
    - Test bulk persona assignment, zone creation, bulk delete
  3. Edge Customization:
    - Drag edge control points to adjust paths
    - Notice edges with existing custom paths
    - Double-click handles to reset
  4. Node Connections:
    - Drag from node handles to create new connections
    - Try connecting zones with semantic types
    - Test attachment drag-and-drop
  5. Search:
    - Open search (Cmd+K)
    - Search for "triage", "prescription", etc.
    - Drag results to canvas
  6. Personas:
    - Open persona manager
    - Assign different personas to tasks
    - Notice color-coded badges
  7. View Modes:
    - Toggle between Default and Experiential view
    - Notice touchpoint emphasis in Experiential mode
    - Designer descriptions appear
  8. History:
    - Make changes
    - Test Undo (Cmd+Z) / Redo (Cmd+Shift+Z)
  9. Copy/Paste:
    - Select nodes
    - Copy (Cmd+C) / Paste (Cmd+V)
    - Notice 20px offset
  10. Alt+Drag Duplication:
    - Select zone with nodes
    - Alt+drag to duplicate with contents

  ---
  ðŸ“Š STATISTICS

  - Total Nodes: 49 (37 functional + 7 zones + 5 annotations)
  - Total Edges: 35 (with labels, custom paths, attachments)
  - Total Personas: 4 (human, ai categories)
  - Total Zones: 7 (5 with semantic types)
  - Total Sticky Notes: 4
  - Node Types Represented: 7/7 (100% coverage)
  - Features Demonstrated: ~25 major features

  ---
  ðŸ” KEY LEARNING AREAS

  For Developers:
  - System architecture patterns
  - AI/Human/System task distribution
  - Data flow through clinical workflows
  - Constraint enforcement points

  For Designers:
  - Patient journey mapping
  - Touchpoint identification
  - User interaction patterns
  - Service design visualization

  For Product Managers:
  - Feature dependencies
  - Automation opportunities
  - Compliance requirements
  - Process optimization

  ---
  This example is your comprehensive playground to test every canvas feature before building your own systems! ðŸš€
